Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Iron Fist[ENDCOLOR]: Vassals can no longer be liberated by other Civilizations or the World Congress, and capitulated vassals can no longer rebel. Yields from City-States increased by 25%, Vassals tribute an additional 25% of their yields, and +50% Worker Improvement rate.
Iron Fist

Ruling with an iron fist generally means to require absolute control when managing other people, often in the workplace. The saying can also refer to situations such as child-rearing or styles of government. This idiom is often used to describe the actions and practices of managers, parents, or leaders who give their subordinates little if any freedom of choice or input regarding decisions. Reasons for ruling with an iron fist can often depend on individual circumstances, such as inexperienced workers or unruly children. The effectiveness of using total control can also vary, depending on the scope of the management style and the situation.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Universal Healthcare[ENDCOLOR]: Receive a free Hospital in every City. +50 [ICON_CULTURE] when a Citizen is born in any City, scaling with Era.
Universal Healthcare

Earn [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points if you Kill a unit or Pillage a non-road improvement. +2 [ICON_GREAT_GENERAL] Great General Points from Ceilidh Hall.
Morrigan, the Harbinger

+3 [ICON_CULTURE_LOCAL] Border Growth in every City. Receive +10 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_FOOD] Food when your Borders expand, scaling with Era. +5 [ICON_CULTURE_LOCAL] Border Growth from Ceilidh Hall.
Epona, the Great Mare

+15% [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from "We Love the King Days". +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, and [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points for every Unique Luxury Resource on Empire and per active [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route to or from the City. +5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Ceilidh Hall.
Nuada, the Silver-Handed

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Forests, +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Jungles. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Camps and Plantations. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Ceilidh Hall.
Cernunnos, the Horned Stag

+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_FOOD] Food, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold in Cities with a Specialist. +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Wonders. +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Ceilidh Hall.
Lugh, the Skilled One

+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in every City, +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from every Resource connected with a normal Improvement. +5 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points from Ceilidh Hall.
Rhiannon, the Sovereign

+3 [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold in coastal Cities. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens working Sea tiles in your Cities. +2 [ICON_GREAT_ADMIRAL] Great Admiral Points from Ceilidh Hall.
Mannanan, Son of the Sea

+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from [ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Works in a City. +3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_GREAT_SCIENTIST] Great Scientist Points, and [ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Great Artist Points in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. +5 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Ceilidh Hall.
Ogma, the Learned

+25% increase in City [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength and +25% [ICON_FOOD] Growth. +15 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold when a [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born, scaling with Era. +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness per following City. +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Ceilidh Hall.
Bran, the Sleeping Guardian

+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, and for every 4 Followers of your Pantheon in owned Cities. +5 HP healed per turn in Friendly Territory. +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from Ceilidh Hall.
Dagda, the All-Father
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Peace, Land, Bread[ENDCOLOR]: [ICON_GOLD] Poverty reduced by 20% and [ICON_FOOD] Growth increased by 20% in all cities. -20% building maintenance modifier.
Peace, Land, Bread

The phrase 'Peace, Land, Bread,' popularized by Lenin and others during the early days of the Soviet Revolution, highlighted their desire to focus on the needs of the impoverished Russian peasantry. The Bolshevik Initial Decrees of the 1910-20s were announced as soon as the Bolsheviks declared their success in the October Revolution (October 26, 1917). The decrees conformed to the popular Bolshevik slogan "Peace, Bread, and Land", taken up by the masses during the July Days (July 1917), an uprising of workers and military forces.
Arts
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arts[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Culture Need by 25%.
Investing production in art is a good way to boost your Civilization's cutural output, either to grab that next policy or to stave off a Tourism victory. Also reduces boredom.
Defense
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Defense[ENDCOLOR] boosts City [ICON_STRENGTH] Defense and increases Hit Point recovery by 10% of the City's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Investing production in defense is a last-ditch method to stave off your city's conquest by a foreign power.
Farming
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Farming[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_FOOD] Food, and reduces [ICON_FOOD]/[ICON_PRODUCTION] Basic Needs by 25%.
Investing production in farming is a good way to boost your City's growth, which can be useful if you are falling behind in technologies, or you simply need bigger cities. Also reduces distress.
First on the Moon
Atomic Bomb
Travel Ban
Restricts international travel between Civilizations. Reduces the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism modifier for all Civilizations by 35%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Flight.
Passport System
Increases international travel between Civilizations. Increases the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism modifier for all Civilizations by 50%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Flight.
Area Damage
Pilum
Splash Damage
Founding a new City has reset the cost increase of Tile purchases in all owned cities!
Manifest Destiny!
